meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The thief despoils the house of its treasures.
meanings.sent2: The invaders despoil the village of its riches.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon despoils the picnic basket of all its goodies.
meanings.sent4: Time despoils us of our youth, leaving only memories behind.
meanings.sent5: The storm despoils the landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.sent1: Pirates despoil the merchant ships of their cargo.
meanings.sent2: Bandits despoil travelers along the lonely road.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky squirrel despoils the bird feeder of all its seeds.
meanings.sent4: Greed despoils the heart of its kindness, leaving only emptiness.
meanings.sent5: The marauders despoil the town, taking everything of value.

meanings.sent1: Neglect despoils the beauty of the garden.
meanings.sent2: Rain despoils the outdoor party, forcing everyone inside.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy despoils the clean floor with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Betrayal despoils the trust between friends, leaving only hurt.
meanings.sent5: The mold despoils the bread, making it inedible.
